content: If the landlord refuses to sign the addendum do I have grounds to terminate early without penalty?
Document the refusal and propose mutual termination with a pro-rated refund. Massachusetts law supports liquidated damages only if outlined in the lease.
How long does the Attorney General's office typically take to respond to complaints?
Mine took about 3 weeks for initial contact, then another month for resolution. Keep following up every 2 weeks.
What if the landlord claims they can't find a contractor? Is that a valid excuse to delay repairs?
No. The landlord's difficulty finding contractors doesn't suspend their legal obligation. After 14 days, you can hire your own contractor and deduct from rent. Keep all receipts.
Is there a maximum amount I can deduct? My heating system repair estimate is $2,500.

Massachusetts doesn't set a specific cap, but the repair must be reasonable and necessary. Get 2-3 quotes and choose a licensed contractor. Document that you gave the landlord proper notice and opportunity to repair first.
Did you have to pay for the Board of Health inspection or is it free?
Completely free! Just call your local Board of Health and request a housing inspection. They're required to investigate within a few days.
How long does the entire eviction court process usually take in Boston?
Currently 3-6 months from notice to actual move-out order, sometimes longer. The court backlog works in tenants' favor. Use this time to save money and find alternative housing if needed.
Also look into RAFT (Residential Assistance for Families in Transition) - they can help with back rent and might stop the eviction entirely.
Has anyone successfully negotiated down the notice period? What argument worked?
I pointed out that 90 days is unusual for Boston and offered to sign a 2-year lease in exchange for 45-day notice. They agreed! Landlords want stability too.
What if only one roommate is on the lease? Does that change the liability situation?

Yes, significantly. The person on the lease is solely responsible to the landlord. The other person is essentially a subtenant. The leaseholder can pursue the subtenant for their share, but the landlord only has a legal relationship with whoever signed.
